{{Community}}
This page contains comprehensive data for elemental shields, including their Gauge Units, HP Ratios, Damage Ratios, as well as the amounts of Gauge Units of different elements required to break them. For an explanation of elemental shield mechanics, see [[Shield/Enemy]].

==Elemental Shields in Co-Op==
Some shields will increase their elemental gauges in [[Co-Op Mode]].

<math>\text{Gauge}_\text{Elemental Shield} = \text{Base Gauge} \times \text{Co-Op Multiplier}</math>

The '''Co-Op Multiplier''' is determined by the amount of players in the same scene.
{| class="article-table"
! Players !! Multiplier
|-
| 2 || 1.5
|-
| 3 || 1.7
|-
| 4 || 2
|}

==Shield Data==
;Notes
* When [[Electro-Charged]] is triggered, {{Hydro}} and {{Electro}} auras will coexist on the target. Every tick of Electro-Charged reduces the shield and the applied aura by 0.4GU until one of them is depleted. Due to the fact that the amount of ticks per Electro-Charged reaction is ''not'' consistent based on the Gauge Unit of the element applied, the below table will only show the amount of ticks required instead of Gauge Units required to break the shield.
* When [[Burning]] is triggered, {{Dendro}}/{{Wood}} will be steadily consumed at a rate of 0.4GU per second. Due to the fact that Burning duration does ''not'' scale based on the Gauge Unit of the element applied, the below table will only show the amount of time required instead of Gauge Units required to break the shield.
* To break {{Geo}} shields using Cryo/Electro/Hydro/Pyro, it is required to apply Cryo/Electro/Hydro/Pyro first and manually applying Geo to trigger [[Crystallize]]. The actual consumption will scale with the amount of GUs left on the Cryo/Electro/Hydro/Pyro aura at the moment Crystallize is triggered, which means it will take into account decay and aura tax.
